examples: Engineer Henry M. Leland was brought on to appraise the company's factory in order to sell it but instead saw potential.
Oh, and showing art in a venerable museum can definitely increase the appraised value of a work of art!
Think of it like seeing your home appraised for less, and immediately putting it up for sale.

One day in 1906, the British scientist Francis Galton headed for a country fair in the town of Plymouth where the local farmers and townspeople gathered to appraise the quality of each other's cattle, sheep, chickens, and horses.
And they rated participants in the group that told themselves they were excited as more persuasive, competent, and confident than the group told to appraise their feelings as anxiety.
words.defineEn: to estimate or assess the value or quality of something
words.defineVi: để ước tính hoặc đánh giá giá trị hoặc chất lượng của một cái gì đó

examples: That's one appraisal.
Emotional appraisal is where you form of judgments about a particular situation.
And our reactions stem in part from our appraisal of that stimulus.
We call this your attention and appraisal.
It’s a pretty cynical appraisal, and it’s not new.
words.defineEn: the act of evaluating someone or something in order to form an opinion or judgment about them
words.defineVi: hành động đánh giá một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó để hình thành một ý kiến hoặc đánh giá về họ

words.defineEn: an attempt to guess or do something without having sufficient information or knowing the consequences
words.defineVi: một nỗ lực để đoán hoặc làm điều gì đó mà không có đủ thông tin hoặc biết hậu quả

examples: Dr. Howard never laid a hand on me to assess my pain.
These two summit events constitute a framework to assess progress being made under the auspices of President Mbeki.
Before investing in a new business venture, it's important to conduct thorough research and assess potential risks.
IARC is just assessing cancer risk, not overall safety.
I assess the new movie Jupiter Ascending-- --on this week's episode of Angry Nerd!
words.defineEn: to form a judgment on the quality, nature, or ability of something or someone
words.defineVi: để hình thành một bản án về chất lượng, bản chất, hoặc khả năng của một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: The Court of Appeal held that there was no evidence to support the judge's assessment.
Three is assessment.
They often reject standardized assessments altogether.
The lawyer for Ahmad Al Aliwi Alissa asked for a mental health assessment.
Yes, the problem is making global assessments like that.
words.defineEn: the act of judging or evaluating someone or something carefully based on specific criteria
words.defineVi: hành động đánh giá hoặc đánh giá một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó một cách cẩn thận dựa trên các tiêu chí cụ thể

examples: The company bets its bottom dollar when it spends a lot of money on advertising.
The company hedged its bets by developing a second line of products.
I bet his ears are burning right now.
She hedged her bets by applying for various other jobs as well.
The pilot's best bet was to make an emergency landing.
words.defineEn: one's opinion or view about something
words.defineVi: ý kiến hoặc quan điểm của một người về một cái gì đó

examples: The store clerk measured the length of the bolt to calculate the customer's purchase.
Formulas calculate the value of cells.
He calculated a speed of about 211 million meters per second.
Then, they calculated the ratio of fast food restaurants to full-service restaurants in each participant’s neighborhood.
So this actually calculates your equity.
words.defineEn: to form an opinion by considering the information at hand
words.defineVi: để hình thành một ý kiến bằng cách xem xét các thông tin trong tầm tay

examples: Here are my calculations.
Microprocessors do the calculations in the twinkling of an eye.
Just give me a back-of-the-envelope calculation.
They use a calculator to help with complex math calculations.
So, string theorists did calculations in model universes.
words.defineEn: the process of using one's information or judgment in order to guess the outcome of a situation
words.defineVi: quá trình sử dụng thông tin hoặc phán đoán của một người để đoán kết quả của một tình huống

examples: The show finished with a dramatic cliffhanger, leaving the audience eager for the next episode.
And then I left you with a cliffhanger.
words.defineEn: an ending to an episode of a series that keeps the audience in suspense
words.defineVi: một kết thúc của một tập phim khiến khán giả hồi hộp

words.defineEn: (of a situation, movie, etc.) having an unclear ending that makes it enticing
words.defineVi: (về một tình huống, bộ phim, v.v.) có một kết thúc không rõ ràng khiến nó trở nên hấp dẫn

words.defineEn: used to refer to an attempt or a guess that was close to achieve success but failed to do so
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ một nỗ lực hoặc một phỏng đoán gần đạt được thành công nhưng không thực hiện được

words.defineEn: almost correct or accurate
words.defineVi: gần đúng hoặc chính xác

examples: He feels the cold a lot.
The film caught a cold over the outstanding debt.
Sarah’s got a cold.
On the day of the wedding, Brown experienced cold feet.
He's out cold and as still as a stone.
words.defineEn: ‌used specifically in children’s games to say that someone is far away from guessing the correct answer or finding a hidden person or object
words.defineVi: ‌được sử dụng cụ thể trong các trò chơi dành cho trẻ em để nói rằng ai đó còn lâu mới đoán được câu trả lời đúng hoặc tìm thấy người hoặc đồ vật bị giấu

words.defineEn: being primarily based on pure guess-work rather than definite knowledge
words.defineVi: chủ yếu dựa trên phỏng đoán thuần túy hơn là kiến thức xác định

examples: MASHA GESSEN - Well, that’s all conjecture.
I'm just conjecturing what it might mean.
To be clear, this is pure conjecture.
I’m not particularly comforted by this idea, but the good news is that this idea isn’t really much more than conjecture.
Cantor's conjecture became known as the continuum hypothesis.
words.defineEn: an idea that is based on guesswork and not facts
words.defineVi: một ý tưởng dựa trên phỏng đoán chứ không phải sự thật

examples: MASHA GESSEN - Well, that’s all conjecture.
I'm just conjecturing what it might mean.
To be clear, this is pure conjecture.
I’m not particularly comforted by this idea, but the good news is that this idea isn’t really much more than conjecture.
Cantor's conjecture became known as the continuum hypothesis.
words.defineEn: to form an idea or opinion about something on the basis of insufficient information or inconclusive evidence
words.defineVi: để hình thành một ý tưởng hoặc quan điểm về một cái gì đó trên cơ sở không đủ thông tin hoặc bằng chứng không thuyết phục

examples: Some thought the elderly woman's critiques of society were outdated and irrelevant, but an old dog barks not in vain, for experience brings valuable perspective.
But its social critique cuts far deeper.
The crux of the critique came down to this.
A few days after its debut, Chick-fil-A tweeted a thinly veiled critique.
Williams actually presents this case as a critique of utilitarianism.
words.defineEn: a detailed judgment of something, such as a work of art, a political idea, etc.
words.defineVi: một đánh giá chi tiết về một cái gì đó, chẳng hạn như một tác phẩm nghệ thuật, một ý tưởng chính trị, v.v.

examples: Some thought the elderly woman's critiques of society were outdated and irrelevant, but an old dog barks not in vain, for experience brings valuable perspective.
But its social critique cuts far deeper.
The crux of the critique came down to this.
A few days after its debut, Chick-fil-A tweeted a thinly veiled critique.
Williams actually presents this case as a critique of utilitarianism.
words.defineEn: to evaluate or examine something in a critical and detailed way
words.defineVi: để đánh giá hoặc kiểm tra một cái gì đó một cách quan trọng và chi tiết

examples: As a manager, I encourage my team to take responsibility for their mistakes and to show understanding and forgiveness towards their colleagues, knowing that to err is human, to forgive divine.
For the Chinese, dragons symbolize divine power, controlling the rain, rivers, sea, and all other bodies of water.
For Mahayana Buddhists, the Buddha was divine.
It was a divine disaster area.
He's like a divine being.
words.defineEn: to figure out something by guessing or using one's intuition
words.defineVi: để tìm ra một cái gì đó bằng cách đoán hoặc sử dụng trực giác của một người

words.defineEn: used when one already knows something or can guess it beforehand
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi một người đã biết điều gì đó hoặc có thể đoán nó trước

examples: However, we can make some educated guesses.
Test out each new hypothesis, or educated guess, yourself.
We don’t know the exact conditions in Enceladus’ oceans, but astronomers do have some educated guesses.
However, everything we know about their language and culture is only an educated guess.
Of course, there are way too many of these guys to actually go out and count them, so scientists have to make educated guesses.
words.defineEn: a guess that is made according to one's experience or knowledge thus is more likely to be true
words.defineVi: một phỏng đoán được thực hiện theo kinh nghiệm hoặc kiến thức của một người do đó có nhiều khả năng đúng hơn

examples: Estimates put the war's cost at £1 million a day.
Their estimates were completely off the mark.
It is estimated that 5,000 bank staff could be lining their own pockets from customer accounts.
Medical scientists estimate an autism ratio of 1 in every 110 children in the United States.
The company estimated revenues for 2020 of nearly 100 million dollars.
words.defineEn: to guess the value, number, quantity, size, etc. of something without exact calculation
words.defineVi: để đoán giá trị, số lượng, số lượng, kích thước, vv của một cái gì đó mà không cần tính toán chính xác

examples: Estimates put the war's cost at £1 million a day.
Their estimates were completely off the mark.
It is estimated that 5,000 bank staff could be lining their own pockets from customer accounts.
Medical scientists estimate an autism ratio of 1 in every 110 children in the United States.
The company estimated revenues for 2020 of nearly 100 million dollars.
words.defineEn: a judgment or calculation of the size, extent, value, etc. of something without knowing the exact details or numbers
words.defineVi: một phán đoán hoặc tính toán về kích thước, mức độ, giá trị, v.v. của một cái gì đó mà không biết các chi tiết hoặc con số chính xác

examples: Our technology is about 99 percent accurate on gender estimation across all races.
Obviously gender estimation is sort of a different type of application, but there never should be errors like that.

A true manic episode is an intense period of restless and often overly optimistic hyperactivity, during which your estimation of yourself and your ideas and your abilities can often get really skewed.
Now you wanna rate the strength of the emotion from zero to 100%, and this number is your own estimation
And in a follow up experiment, they found that size estimations from memory were less accurate than those made when directly looking at something.
words.defineEn: a judgment of or an opinion about the value or qualities of something
words.defineVi: một đánh giá hoặc một ý kiến về giá trị hoặc phẩm chất của một cái gì đó
